section.title: Overview
section.p: The NCC application generates lifecycle Charging Data Records (CDRs) to track changes that occur in lifecycle entities. The lifecycle entities are accounts, subscriptions, devices, groups, and users. Every lifecycle CDR contains attributes that identify the triggering event that caused the change and all the information related to the change that took place, including the transitions and states used. Each lifecycle CDR corresponds to one triggering event but might contain records related to more than one entity.
The lifecycle CDRs are produced when one of the following incident happens:

li.p: Fee is charged or cannot be charged.
Lifecycle entity's billing cycle is calculated.
Extend timer API is used to reschedule the current transition time.
Account reset is unsuccessful since its overage limit is greater than reset value.

section.p: Most commonly the lifecycle CDRs are triggered by lifecycle actions.
For more information on CDRs, see the NCC CDR/EDR Reference guide.
